title: Using skills during Syndra ult
body:
Recently got this champ and love her (warm regards to {{champion:74}}, {{champion:1}} ). My question is, can I use other skills during her ult? Wouldn't it interrupt it?
I understand i could figure it out by myself, but I also would appreciate any of of tips and tricks playing her. Thank you

replies.body: Yes u can. Her ulti goes off fully even if she dies sec after issuing cast.

If you're quick you can sometimes also sneak an extra Sphere into the ult mid cast. The ult checks for Spheres to fire throughout its duration, so casting Q just after R will still get the following Sphere included.

1 million people assumingly play this?  Ok well 900,000 of those people dont have a boards account. 

If you're going to try to pull statistics on a math major atleast know whats affecting those stats kid.

If you actually knew your stats, you'd know to say that the statistical significance of a sample is based on the size of the sample, not the size of the population. 

For example, suppose you want to measure the average fire ant thorax length. You only have to measure a reasonably sized sample of a few hundred, even though there are billions of fire ants. Similarly, political polls measure in hundreds, even though the US voter turnout is in the hundreds of millions.

The real statistical issue here is selection bias. You say most people don't have boards accounts; it's possible that the method of surveying by polling boards users biases the results. In addition, there is also response bias, where people who do not have very polarized opinions simply do not respond.

Yet you are still using the .0004% to prove the will of a substantial amount of people. If 900,000 of those people do not have an account, then that skews the data. Instead of .0004% you have ~.004% for, ~.001% against, and .005% abstanding. But it still affects the million+ who did not vote, so in the end you still only have the change being dictated by less than .0004% of Leagues players. That many upvotes may warrant a look-see of the post, but nowhere enough for the action to be undertaken as "the will of the people".
